name: New Year's Day
desc: New Year's Day is the first day of the Gregorian calendar, which is widely used in many countries such as the USA.

name: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
desc: Martin Luther King Day marks the anniversary of the date of birth of the influential American civil right leader of the same name.

name: Inauguration Day (DC, MD*, VA*)
desc: On Inauguration Day, the president and vice-president of the United States of America are sworn in and take office.

name: Presidents' Day
desc: Washington's Birthday, or Presidents' Day, honors the life and work of the first president of the United States, George Washington.

name: Memorial Day
desc: Memorial Day commemorates all Americans who have died in military service for the United States.

name: 'Juneteenth' day off
desc: Juneteenth, also known as Freedom Day and Emancipation Day, is a holiday or observance in many US states to celebrate the anniversary of the abolition of slavery in Texas on June 19, 1865.

name: 'Independence Day' day off
desc: On Independence Day, Americans celebrate the anniversary of publication of the Declaration of Independence from Great Britain in 1776.

name: Labor Day
desc: Labor Day is a federal holiday in the United States. It gives workers a day of rest and it celebrates their contribution to the American economy.

name: Columbus Day
desc: Columbus Day celebrates 15th century explorer Christopher Columbus's arrival in America in 1492.

name: Veterans Day
desc: Veterans Day in the USA is a holiday to honor all who have served in the United States Military Services.

name: Thanksgiving Day
desc: Thanksgiving Day in the United States is traditionally a holiday to give thanks for the food collected at the end of the harvest season.

name: 'Christmas Day' day off
desc: Christmas Day celebrates Jesus Christ's birth.

name: 'New Year's Day' day off
desc: New Year's Day is the first day of the Gregorian calendar, which is widely used in many countries such as the USA.
